ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] RE: Clothing or armor for a Mage
ygData.msgSnippet: to be honest with you go to the tunnel in EC and see if anyone has anything for a mage to wear I had a great tunic given to me which is a robe and adds mana
ygData.messageBody:
to be honest with you go to the tunnel in EC and see
if anyone has anything for a mage to wear

I had a great tunic given to me which is a robe and
adds mana and other stuff too

this is all you should worry about imho.
Like it has been said, you are better getting rusty
weaps for pets and other weaps, or summone one when
you get high enough.


Get magic items to increase mana and things to raise
mana after spent

My mage shields himself, buffs pet, and then cast a DD
spell to get thigns going. Then pet attacks, me
watching health, and when pet drops to 50%, I step in
and hit with my Staff to take aggro off pet while
casting or trying to cast a few DD spells


Hope this helps

Rob

--- "Steven R. Hulse" <steve@...>
wrote:
> Message: 2
> Date: Thu, 18 Jul 2002 09:18:04 +0200
> From: alexander.jones@...
> Subject: RE: Clothing or armor for a Mage
>
> Forget the AC as mage, it wont do you any good. Get
> more +int and +mana
> on
> your items, it will help you way more in the long
> run. And get your
> focus
> items.
>
>
> [Steven R. Hulse] I guess AC was a bad term to use,
> Mostly I was wanting
> to know about clothing other than the cheap crap,
> cloth stuff. I was
> wondering mostly about leather goods. For example, I
> found soft wicker
> legging in Ak'anon but I'm afraid to buy them
> because I'll just waste
> money I can use on other things like spells. I was
> just hoping for a
> little better protection other than cloth.
>
> Thanks though! ;-)
>
________________________________________________________________________
>
> Message: 14
> Date: Thu, 18 Jul 2002 21:13:29 -0000
> From: "bigmaca3" <bigmaca3@...>
> Subject: Re: Clothing or armor for a Mage
>
>
> There a lot of newbie armor quests out there now. I
> heard the
> Gnomes armor were going to be in the next patch.
> You might check the
> Arcane Order Armor quests in Qeynos, or the similar
> ones in
> Freeport. These all have minor stats on them, but
> they're better
> than cloth and sometimes even raw silk. You are
> well above the level
> range for them so they should be easy to get.
>
> Tuldayen Grimblade
> 38th Season Ranger of Tunare
> Terris-Thule
>
> [Steven R. Hulse]
> Hopefully so! I don't care if my Mage can go to full
> armor, just
> something to offer a little more protection than
> cloth. I found the Orcs
> love to pick on the little guys! Yesterday I was
> playing my new warrior
> Gnome and went to Orc hill and man I was even there
> yet and already had
> 3 of them on my butt! I got creamed but it was fun
> though!
>
>
>
________________________________________________________________________
>
________________________________________________________________________
>
> Message: 15
> Date: Thu, 18 Jul 2002 21:15:55 -0000
> From: "bigmaca3" <bigmaca3@...>
> Subject: Re: Magician stuff
>
> /help pet will bring up all the pet commands. I
> would suggest you
> hotkey several of them, at least /pet attack and
> /pet back off. It
> helps not having to type all that stuff out.
>
> [Steven R. Hulse]
> Cool thanks, I did get some in the other night. I
> couldn't figure out
> how to get my pet to guard and attack other than be
> attacked myself.
>
>
>
